summary: The implementation covers most requirements but has several critical gaps: missing genre/category support in uploads and browsing, no organized category rows, missing 'More Info' functionality, and incomplete validation. The backend lacks a method to retrieve all films, forcing a localStorage workaround.

missing_requirements.requirement: Upload form must accept genre/category field
missing_requirements.reason: The UploadFilmForm only captures title, description, thumbnail, and video. No genre/category input field exists.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend storage of film metadata including genre/category
missing_requirements.reason: The Film type in backend/main.mo only stores id, title, description, thumbnail, and video. No genre/category field exists.

missing_requirements.requirement: Films organized into horizontal scrolling rows by category or genre
missing_requirements.reason: BrowsePage shows only 'Your Films' and 'Recently Added' rows without any category-based organization. No genre filtering or categorization logic exists.

missing_requirements.requirement: Clicking a film opens detailed view or playback interface
missing_requirements.reason: Clicking a film navigates directly to the player. No detailed view or film information page exists before playback.

hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest specifies 'use Internet Identity if auth is needed' as a non-goal consideration, but does not explicitly require authentication. The implementation forces login before uploading.
Not requested in requirements. The backend should provide a method to retrieve all films, but instead the frontend uses localStorage as a workaround.

hallucinated_features.description: More Info button in hero banner
hallucinated_features.reason: The HeroBanner component includes a 'More Info' button, but no functionality or detailed view page is implemented for it.

hallucinated_features.description: Fixed top-10 film limit in browsing
hallucinated_features.reason: BrowsePage hardcodes support for only 10 films maximum. This arbitrary limit was not requested and contradicts the 'all uploaded films' requirement.
